alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 11:03AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 230 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Watsonville, Gilroy, Morgan Hill, Corralitos, Brown Valley Road, Eureka Canyon Road, Uvas Canyon Park, Amesti, Interlaken, Freedom, Aptos, Rio Del Mar, Moss Landing, Day Valley, Aptos Hills-Larkin, Aptos Hills-Larkin Valley, Pajaro, Las Lomas and San Martin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
